header.title: Πώς να Δημιουργηθεί μια Κατάρα! (How to Create a Curse!)

central_thesis: This manual presents a practical, step-by-step ritual for enacting curses and destructive magic through the invocation of specific spirits associated with the 50 Names of Marduk, as interpreted by the Simon Necronomicon. It frames the practice as a means to achieve external retribution and internal psychological release from negative emotions.

structure_content.summary: The text opens by positioning itself as a guide to destructive magic and retribution, emphasizing its utility for both external harm and internal emotional catharsis. It asserts that magical harm is beyond legal jurisdiction and requires no prior belief, only careful adherence to its five steps.

The author establishes the ritual's foundation in the 'Necronomicon Spellbook' by Simon, tracing its origins to Sumerian and Babylonian texts, particularly the Enuma Elish. It describes the mythological war between Marduk and the Ancient Ones (Tiamat, Kingu, Azag-Thoth) and the acquisition of the 50 Names by Marduk. Various theories on the nature of these '50 Powers' are presented, including spiritual entities, egregores (thought-forms created by ancient Sumerian mages), cosmic forces, or hidden human psychological powers. Aleister Crowley's interest in the Simon Necronomicon is noted for added gravitas.

Four specific spirits from the 50 Names of Marduk are identified as agents of destruction, death, and sickness, suitable for curses: SURIM, SUNGURIM, ZARIM, and ZAHGURIM. For each, the text provides its Name, a specific 'Word of Power' (Λέξη Δύναμης), a unique sigil (Σφραγίδα), and a concise description of its destructive capability.

structure_content.chapter_title: Ritual Preparation and Setup (Πρώτο & Δεύτερο Βήμα)
structure_content.summary: This section details the practical requirements: two white candles, A4 paper, a black marker, and 20 minutes. It instructs the practitioner to copy the chosen spirit's sigil, cut it out, and keep it secret. The ritual should be performed on a quiet night (ideally 3 AM), with candles placed around the sigil on a table facing North. Optional incense (pine, sandalwood, cedar) and a full moon are suggested. The practitioner should mentally focus on the target before beginning.

The core magical operation involves facing North, deep breathing, and chanting specific Sumerian phrases (ZI KIA KANPA, ZI ANNA KANPA, ZI DINGIR KIA KANPA, ZI DINGIR ANNA KANPA). The practitioner then invokes the chosen spirit by Name and its associated Word of Power. Crucially, the ritual demands intense visualization of the target suffering the desired destructive outcome and the channeling of the practitioner's anger and hatred into this mental image, emphasizing that the curse will fail without this emotional component. Distractions from 'undeveloped psychic entities' are to be ignored.

After 10-15 minutes of intense visualization, the ritual is concluded by reciting further Sumerian phrases, acknowledging the Spirits of Earth and Heaven. The practitioner takes three breaths, extinguishes the candles, turns the sigil upside down, and stores it for future use. The text promises results within days or weeks.

The author stresses the irreversibility of the curse and the necessity of absolute resolve from the practitioner, warning against remorse. It encourages the use of this knowledge against 'enemies of Greece,' such as politicians, foreign bankers, and multinational corporations aligned with the 'New World Order,' suggesting the curse can be directed at them by name or photograph.

key_concepts.definition: A specific grimoire authored by Simon, serving as the explicit foundation for the described ritual. It claims to revive ancient magical practices rooted in Sumerian and Babylonian texts, particularly the Enuma Elish.

A collection of 50 titles, each representing a distinct spiritual or energetic entity. These names were bestowed upon Marduk after his victory over the Ancient Ones (Tiamat, Kingu, Azag-Thoth) in Babylonian mythology. The text explores various ontological theories for these powers, including their nature as independent entities, thought-forms (egregores), cosmic forces, or latent human psychological faculties.

Four specific entities (SURIM, SUNGURIM, ZARIM, ZAHGURIM) from the 50 Names of Marduk, designated for causing destruction, death, sickness, and general curses. Each spirit is associated with a unique name, Word of Power, and sigil, and is used for specific baneful outcomes.

A unique symbolic drawing or emblem associated with each spirit. It functions as a magical key or focal point for the ritual, serving as a conduit or representation for the spirit's energy and influence.

A specific Sumerian incantation or potent utterance linked to each spirit (e.g., MASSANERGKAL for SURIM). These are recited during the ritual to directly invoke, command, and focus the spirit's power.

The magical act of inflicting destructive outcomes, such as disease, accident, psychological collapse, or death, upon a target. The efficacy of the curse is contingent upon the practitioner's unwavering intent and the forceful channeling of strong negative emotions (anger, hatred) into the ritual.

One of the proposed explanations for the nature of the 50 Powers, suggesting they are forgotten 'thought-forms' or 'skeptomorphs' created by Sumerian mages millennia ago. These entities reside in the Astral/Etheric plane and are re-energized and made accessible through modern magical practice, particularly via works like the Simon Necronomicon.

practical_system.description: The system outlines a five-step ritual for enacting curses using specific destructive spirits from the Simon Necronomicon's '50 Names of Marduk'. It integrates sigil magic, specific invocations in Sumerian, intense visualization, and the channeling of practitioner's negative emotions to manifest a desired harmful outcome against a target.
tools: Sigil of the chosen spirit (drawn by hand)
rituals: Step 1: Sigil Creation & Preparation: Draw the chosen spirit's sigil with a black marker on A4 paper, cut it out, and keep it private and secure.

Step 2: Ritual Setup: Perform at night (ideally 3 AM) in a quiet place. Place two white candles flanking the sigil on a table facing North. Optionally, burn pine, sandalwood, or cedar incense. Meditate on the target.
Step 3: Opening Invocation: Facing North, take three deep breaths, then slowly and clearly recite: 'ZI KIA KANPA', 'ZI ANNA KANPA', 'ZI DINGIR KIA KANPA', 'ZI DINGIR ANNA KANPA'.

Step 4: Spirit Invocation & Visualization: Lower gaze to the sigil. Recite: 'Listen to me: [Spirit Name]', 'Come to me through the Powers of the Word: [Word of Power]', 'And answer my prayer!' followed by repeating 'ZI KIA KANPA!' and 'ZI ANNA KANPA!'. Simultaneously, intensely visualize the target suffering the curse (destruction, disease, accident, psychological collapse) and channel all anger and hatred into this vivid mental image.

Step 5: Closing the Ritual: After 10-15 minutes of visualization, recite: 'ZI DINGIR KIA KANPA', 'ZI DINGIR ANNA KANPA', 'Spirit of Earth, remember!', 'Spirit of Heaven, remember!'. Take three deep breaths, extinguish candles, turn the sigil upside down, and store it for future use.

relevant_quotes.text: Αυτή τη στιγμή έχεις στα χέρια σου μια σημαντική και ταυτόχρονα επικίνδυνη πληροφορία. Μια δύναμη καταστροφής αλλά και απονομής δικαιοσύνης! (At this moment you hold in your hands important and at the same time dangerous information. A power of destruction and also of justice!)

Με το τελετουργικό που θα σου παρουσιάσω μπορείς να κάνεις δολοφονίες και καταστροφές ανθρώπων εξ αποστάσεως! Έτσι κανένας νόμος δε θα σε σταματήσει, αφού δε θεωρείται έγκλημα όταν γίνεται με τη μαγεία. (With the ritual I will present to you, you can commit murders and destruction of people from a distance! Thus no law will stop you, as it is not considered a crime when done with magic.)

Δε χρειάζεται να έχεις καθόλου πίστη για να λειτουργήσει, απλά ακολούθησε τα Πέντε Βήματα με προσοχή! Δες το ως πείραμα, ως μια ευκαιρία για να διαπιστώσεις αν η μαγεία υπάρχει. (You don't need any faith for it to work, just follow the Five Steps carefully! See it as an experiment, as an opportunity to find out if magic exists.)
Άμα δεν έχεις θυμό να στείλεις, μη περιμένεις να λειτουργήσει η κατάρα! (If you don't have anger to send, don't expect the curse to work!)

Κλείνοντας να πω ότι είναι σημαντικό πριν κάνεις τη κατάρα, να σιγουρευτείς ότι δε νοιάζεσαι εάν ο εχθρός σου ζήσει ή πεθάνει, κι ότι δε θα αισθανθείς τύψεις όταν θα έχει έρθει η καταστροφή του. Αφού το τελετουργικό ολοκληρωθεί, δεν αντιστρέφεται η διαδικασία. (In closing, I must say that it is important, before casting the curse, to be sure that you don't care if your enemy lives or dies, and that you will not feel remorse when their destruction comes. Once the ritual is complete, the process is irreversible.)

critical_analysis.relevance: This document offers a rare, explicit, and practical guide to baneful magic derived directly from the 'Simon Necronomicon' tradition, a significant grimoire in modern Western Esotericism. It showcases the syncretic nature of this current, blending ancient Mesopotamian mythology with a practical, accessible ritual structure. The emphasis on psychological intention (anger, hatred) and visualization aligns with principles found in Chaos Magic, while its structured approach to spirit invocation is characteristic of traditional grimoire work. It provides valuable insight into operative magical practices focused on retribution and destruction.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The target audience includes practitioners seeking a direct method for enacting curses and baneful magic, those interested in the practical application of the Simon Necronomicon, and individuals seeking emotional catharsis or a sense of justice through occult means. The text also implicitly targets those with specific political grievances, encouraging the use of these curses against perceived 'enemies' of Greece.
